channel.title: DTO
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from DTO, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Treasury Sec. Bessent says China, U.S. have 'opportunity for a big deal' on trade
item.description: Bessent named-checked Bridgewater founder Ray Dalio, who recently express fears of sharp fallout from President Donald Trump's tariff policies.

item.title: Dow industrials jump 800-plus points at opening bell — live updates
Treasury Sec. Bessent calls out China, World Bank, IMF in speech on global economy
item.description: "China needs to change," Treasury Department chief Scott Bessent told the Institute of International Finance in Washington, D.C.

item.title: Trump says he has 'no intention' of firing Fed Chair Powell
item.description: Powell, whom Trump appointed Fed chair during his first term as president, has flatly stated that the president cannot remove him under the law.

item.title: Apple to appeal latest European Commission fine as Meta says it's still deciding
Bond market expresses relief as Trump shifts tone on Powell, China — follow live
Economic calendar: Fed speeches and release of ‘Beige Book’ on daily planner
Scott Bessent’s gentler message: ‘America First’ does not mean ‘America alone’
U.S. public schools brace for ‘fiscal cliff’ after surge in hiring meets budget shortfalls
item.description: Federal pandemic-era funding masked budget gaps tied to enrollment loss. With that money gone, many U.S. schools are making deep cuts to stay afloat.

item.title: Bessent says he expects 'de-escalation' in U.S.-China tariff fight in the 'very near future'
item.description: Stocks, already recovering from the prior day's sell-off, soared higher on news of the remarks from Trump Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent.
